Topic.Title: Inky Path: An Interactive Fiction Literary Magazine

Posts.EditableText:
Hi all you Quest users (and to everyone else who has games on the Quest site),

I thought you guys might be interested in submitting to my new interactive fiction lit mag, Inky Path. 

I've started an interactive fiction literary magazine, Inky Path. I've posted some info below for those looking for specifics. Feel free to submit work that you already have on this site; we'd love to see it. 

Inky Path: [url=http://inkypath.wordpress.com/:3l02fzjt]http://inkypath.wordpress.com/[/url:3l02fzjt]
Facebook: [url=https://www.facebook.com/inkypath:3l02fzjt]https://www.facebook.com/inkypath[/url:3l02fzjt]
Twitter: [url=https://twitter.com/InkyPath:3l02fzjt]https://twitter.com/InkyPath[/url:3l02fzjt]

Thanks everyone! Please submit your work and share with friends! For questions, comments, etc. you can reply here or email the mag at inkypath[AT]gmail.com.

--


[b:3l02fzjt]What is Inky Path?[/b:3l02fzjt]

Inky Path is the first literary magazine that showcases interactive fiction and provides readers with the tools to create their own game. It is about fostering a community of thought and discussion around IF works, seeing pieces for more than their entertainment value, and providing greater exposure of IF to the literary world. 

[b:3l02fzjt]What are you looking for? [/b:3l02fzjt]

We are looking for talented IF writers like yourselves to submit your interactive fiction to the site. There can't be a literary magazine without submissions, so we welcome everyone to bring forth their best work!

It's fine if your work is published elsewhere. You can also submit excerpts or the beginnings of pieces if you want. We welcome pieces of all lengths, types, and flavors. Bring us your best hypertext historical fiction, or parser-based paranormal romance. Or get even more experimental and send in some multimedia medley that defies all convention or classification. Have fun with it. 

Check out the [url=http://inkypath.wordpress.com/submissions:3l02fzjt]submission guidelines[/url:3l02fzjt] for more info on submitting. We are accepting year-round. 

NOTE: We are also currently looking for more readers and graphic designers to help staff the magazine. [url=http://inkypath.wordpress.com/apply-for-a-position/:3l02fzjt]Click here[/url:3l02fzjt] if you would like to know more about becoming part of the staff.

[b:3l02fzjt]How can I help?[/b:3l02fzjt]

Since this is a relatively new publication, please, spread the word! Even if you are not personally interested in submitting, pass on the info to someone you know would love to. Since this really is the first of its kind, I'm hoping that it will succeed--I think it's something that the IF community has needed for a long time. 

If you want to help fund the project, we also accept [url=http://inkypath.wordpress.com/contact/:3l02fzjt]donations[/url:3l02fzjt] .

What is Inky Path?

Inky Path is the first literary magazine that showcases interactive fiction and provides readers with the tools to create their own game. It is about fostering a community of thought and discussion around IF works, seeing pieces for more than their entertainment value, and providing greater exposure of IF to the literary world.

What are you looking for?

We are looking for talented IF writers like yourselves to submit your interactive fiction to the site. There can't be a literary magazine without submissions, so we welcome everyone to bring forth their best work!

It's fine if your work is published elsewhere. You can also submit excerpts or the beginnings of pieces if you want. We welcome pieces of all lengths, types, and flavors. Bring us your best hypertext historical fiction, or parser-based paranormal romance. Or get even more experimental and send in some multimedia medley that defies all convention or classification. Check out the submission guidelines for more info on submitting. We are accepting year-round.

Since this really is the first of its kind, I'm hoping that it will succeed--I think it's something that the IF community has needed for a long time.

If you want to help fund the project, we also accept donations .

Posts.EditableText: UPDATE: We are now accepting guest blog post entries for Inky Path's blog. If you want to write about the state of writing, fiction, or interactive fiction today, or post any reviews for IF pieces, this is the place you can do it! We will also accept re-posts of entries you might have already posted to your own blog. We are also still accepting submissions for Volume 1. Remember that your piece can be published elsewhere, and we accept most types of interactive fiction. For guidelines on submitting your interactive fiction piece, or your blog entry, check out the submission guidelines here: http://inkypath.wordpress.com/submissions/ Hope to be hearing from you soon! -- Inky Path: http://inkypath.wordpress.com/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/inkypath Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/InkyPath inkypath[at]gmail.com
Posts.HTML:
UPDATE:

We are now accepting guest blog post entries for Inky Path's blog. If you want to write about the state of writing, fiction, or interactive fiction today, or post any reviews for IF pieces, this is the place you can do it! We will also accept re-posts of entries you might have already posted to your own blog.

We are also still accepting submissions for Volume 1. Remember that your piece can be published elsewhere, and we accept most types of interactive fiction.

For guidelines on submitting your interactive fiction piece, or your blog entry, check out the submission guidelines here: http://inkypath.wordpress.com/submissions/

Hope to be hearing from you soon!

--

Inky Path: http://inkypath.wordpress.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/inkypath
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/InkyPath
inkypath[at]gmail.com

Posts.EditableText:
One last update for now: 

Just wanted to let everyone know that Vol. 1.1 is officially released! 

[img:3l01knn6]http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3429/12994060374_9bc17f6e56_n.jpg[/img:3l01knn6]

You can check it out [url=http://inkypath.wordpress.com/volume-1-1-winter-2014/:3l01knn6]here[/url:3l01knn6]. 

We are now accepting submissions for Vol 1.2 (scheduled for release May 31st) as well as blog posts on IF (for more on that, see Inky's [url=http://inkypath.wordpress.com/submissions/:3l01knn6]Submissions[/url:3l01knn6] page.)  

Thanks everyone!

Posts.EditableText: Hope you've had a great Labor Day Weekend! Just wanted to let everyone know that Inky Path has released its third volume, Hidden in Shadows. [b:11fz3m48]You can access it [url=http://inkypathmag.com/volume-1-3-hidden-in-shadows//:11fz3m48]here[/url:11fz3m48].[/b:11fz3m48] We are now accepting pieces for Volume 1.4, and will be accepting submissions [b:11fz3m48]through the end of October.[/b:11fz3m48] We'd love to see your work! Visit our submissions page for more info: http://inkypathmag.com/submissions/ [img:11fz3m48]https://inkypath.files.wordpress.com/2014/08/inky_cover3.jpg[/img:11fz3m48] Thanks everyone!
Posts.HTML:
Hope you've had a great Labor Day Weekend!

Just wanted to let everyone know that Inky Path has released its third volume, Hidden in Shadows. You can access it here.

We are now accepting pieces for Volume 1.4, and will be accepting submissions through the end of October. We'd love to see your work! Visit our submissions page for more info: http://inkypathmag.com/submissions/



Thanks everyone!

Posts.EditableText: Liked and Followed. Edit: Didn't see the blog and saw this near the top of the forum, so I thought this was fairly new. Didn't realize it was discontinued.
